title: As the Catholic Church ‘reconsiders’ priesthood and marriage, restraint finds a champion in Kanye
text:
There’s much to learn about the virtues of self-denial in the rapper's new album

You might have read something along the lines of: “Pope Says Priests Can Get Married Now”. That’s not true; it’s not even how decisions get made. But the Catholic Church is discussing allowing some married men in some corners of the Amazon to become priests – and it’s as good an opportunity as any to defend the principle of celibacy.

It might seem an odd place to start, but there’s much to learn in Kanye West’s new album, Jesus is King. Kanye (an eccentric American rapper whose wife has a famously big bottom) has come out as a Christian. It might be an innovation in pop culture, but the album’s lyrics reach back...
